quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Debra Messing and Grace
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, college. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: TV actress Debra Messing was voted Junior Miss of what state?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rhode Island

questions.question: From which college did American actress Debra Messing graduate?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brandeis

questions.question: Who played Grace Adlers mother in the Will and Grace TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Debbie Reynolds

questions.question: Which actor and screenwriter did Debra Messing marry on September 3, 2000?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Daniel Zelman

questions.question: In what year did Emmy Award-winning actress Debra Messing gave birth to her first child?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2004

questions.question: Who portrayed Grace Adlers father in the Will and Grace TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Alan Arkin

questions.question: On the TV series Seinfeld” Jerry was very smitten with the character played by actress Debra Messing. What stood in Jerrys way?

options.text: She was not a very neat person.
She wanted Jerry to change his job.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She was married and anti-Semitic.

questions.question: The first TV show appearance of Emmy Award-winning actress Debra Messing was in which of these TV series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: NYPD Blue

questions.question: Which of the following was Debra Messings first movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A Walk in the Clouds

questions.question: Will and Grace was perhaps Debra Messings most popular TV work. Whom did she beat out for the role of Grace Adler?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nicollette Sheridan

questions.question: What was the name of character who married Grace in the sitcom Will and Grace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Leo Markus

questions.question: Actor Buster Keaton was born in Piqua, Kansas on October 4, what year?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1895

questions.question: How many Emmys did American actress Debra Messing win for Will and Grace?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1

questions.question: When Buster Keaton was young, his vaudeville performance with his parents represented what situation?

options.text: His mother yelled at Buster and his dad as they ran about the stage.
His mother played saxophone while his father became angry and threw Buster around.
His parents joked about raising a kid and then Buster would perform physical comedy.
His parents argued about raising a kid and then Buster would tell jokes.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: His mother played saxophone while his father became angry and threw Buster around.

questions.question: Which was the first TV show in which American actress Debra Messing played the female leading role?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ned and Stacey

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: John Wayne and Buster Keaton
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, john. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: For which of these movies was Jane Fonda nominated for best actress in a lead role?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Morning After

questions.question: Was John Wayne offered the part of Matt Dillon on Gunsmoke?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Who was actor Buster Keatons first wife?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Natalie Talmadge

questions.question: What made Buster Keaton and his mother put an end to the family vaudeville act?

options.text: Buster wanted a bigger audience than the act could ever get.
The reason was Busters fathers alcoholism.
Travelling shows were outlawed in the USA.
The reason was that they didnt make enough money.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The reason was Busters fathers alcoholism.

questions.question: Buster Keaton produced, directed and starred in which 1924 comedy film?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sherlock, Jr.

questions.question: Name Buster Keatons third wife, who was 23 years his senior and appeared with him in the Cirque Medrano in Paris in the 1940s and 1950s.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Eleanor Norris

questions.question: In 1917, Buster Keaton befriended which American silent film actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roscoe Fatty  Arbuckle

questions.question: When did actor Buster Keaton die?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1966

questions.question: Who nicknamed Joseph Frank Keaton Buster?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Harry Houdini

questions.question: What was Flip Wilsons real name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Clerow Wilson

questions.question: When was John Wayne born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: May 26, 1907

questions.question: John Wayne requested that his tombstone read Feo, Fuerte y Formal. What does this mean in English?

options.text: The Good, the Bad, And the Ugly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ugly, Strong and Serious

questions.question: Is it true that John Wayne had 6 children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: No

questions.question: Why did actor Buster Keaton adopt his famous deadpan look?

options.text: Buster found that a deadpan look on his face made the audience laugh more.
Being thrown around finally drove Buster mad which showed as a deadpan look.
One day, he was angry and refused to smile.
DeMille suggested it as an addition to the humor of the gags.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Buster found that a deadpan look on his face made the audience laugh more.

questions.question: One of Flip Wilsons  most popular characters was Geraldine. Who was Geraldines boyfriend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Killer

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Flip Wilson and Actor
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, actor, stars. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Although his claims to be related to former Vice President Al Gore remain dubious, this fiery American author, playwright and social critic is definitely the stepbrother of Jacqueline Onassis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gore Vidal

questions.question: What did Flip Wilsons character Geraldine say when she was caught doing something wrong?

options.text: Well, dont just look at me!
The devil made me do it!
You betta be looking at me because Im  beautiful!

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The devil made me do it!

questions.question: Which two comedians were writers of the successful variety show called The Flip Wilson Show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Richard Pryor and George Carlin

questions.question: Who played the wife of Flip Wilsons character on Charlie  Co.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Gladys Knight

questions.question: This actor, who became famous with the movie Captain Blood, had an adventurous son who was presumed to have been killed during the Vietnam War while on assignment as a photographer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Errol Flynn

questions.question: Jaleel White played the youngest child on the sitcom Charlie  Co.?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Burns

questions.question: This veteran actor, producer and director, who appeared in Clockwatchers and Pie in the Sky, is the scion of  a Hollywood family that played a large role in the making of Paramount Pictures.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bob Balaban

questions.question: The Flip Wilson Show won two Emmys in 1971.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This multi-Oscar-nominated actor, who is one of the very few film stars to have graduated from Harvard, had a dad who served atop the executive layer of  a huge East Coast baking company.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jack Lemmon

questions.question: Which statement about Flip Wilson is untrue?

options.text: Flips wives were named Peaches and Tuanchai.
Flips last album was an album of songs he performed.
Flip quit show business to take care of his kids.
Flip joined the US Air Force at the age of 16.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Flips last album was an album of songs he performed.

questions.question: Which statement concerning comedian Flip Wilson is untrue?

options.text: In 2002, Flip made an unsuccessful sitcom on CBS.
Flip claimed that one of the homes he owned  was haunted.
There is a song about Flip called Nosliw Pilf.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: In 2002, Flip made an unsuccessful sitcom on CBS.

questions.question: What was the name of the sitcom on which Flip Wilson starred from 1985-1986?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charlie and Company

questions.question: This actor and director had his own eponymous TV show in the 1950s, his daughter had her own sitcom in the 1960s, and his businessman father was the president of  the New York  Rubber Co. Who was he?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Robert Montgomery

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: William Shatner and Ashley Judd
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, trek, born. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What does the adjective Shaternian refer to?

options.text: A celebrity life in which one is totally identified with one particular role
An attitude best described as self-centered and egotistical
A clipped, dramatic narration with many dramatic pauses
A life in which one is involved with dozens of vocations

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A clipped, dramatic narration with many dramatic pauses

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: French

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

options.text: He was the CEO of the firm that did the special effects.
He was the narrator in the movie.
He co-starred with Jeff Daniels and Dana Delaney.
He had a cameo appearance in the final scene.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He was the CEO of the firm that did the special effects.

questions.question: In the popular Star Trek series, who played the Captain of the Enterprise for one episode before William Shatner took the role?

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tiberius

He breeds and shows Saint Bernards from his Massachusetts farm.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: He breeds and shows quarter horses from his Kentucky farm
